recent_review.body: Tom and Beverly agreed to help us with a difficult situation we were navigating from overseas involving multiple stages, permits, inspections, architectural drawings, supervision of subcontractors, coordination with our tenants, and more. From the very beginning they were detailed and clear in their communication, suggested solutions that saved us money and also made sense, and handled all aspects of the job from contracting with other companies to permits and inspections with absolute professionalism and thoroughness. We had full confidence that they were on our side, and they made what was a completely unexpected and complicated problem solvable. We are thrilled with their work, their expertise, and their outstanding customer focus. We would gladly hire them again for any home improvement or repair issues, and recommend them wholeheartedly!

881021.description:

Small to mid-size additions are within our scope and capabilities.  Handyman services are offered to provide a full line of home improvement services to our customer base.

Owners - Beverly Brunetti: Architect
Owners - Thomas Bijak: General Contractor

recent_review.body:
Recently have completed a couple of jobs with Karma Construction Group, as a Real estate investor, they were very fair and on point.
Their Team knows the process of a project, and Craig, the PM, was always on top of all their workers and subs. Jordan, the owner, was very professional and understanding of the process of a flip, especially being able to understand how to work with investors.
They do everything from A to Z, and I definitely recommend them to anyone out there looking to do any home improvement.
As they started doing Solar lately, I'm Currently waiting for them to do Solar on one of my projects. Thank you KCG.

4700872.description:
We've grown!  Look for us in North Carolina and South Florida!
Karma Construction Group based in Washington DC, is a boutique Dream and Build Construction Firm. Our customers always come first and our work is never complete until your satisfaction is achieved. We strive to create and foster that "good karma" feeling with our clients and by giving back to organizations that are important to our community. 
 
Our goal is to provide the best remodeling products at an affordable price. We keep our offices modest in size and do not lease "showrooms", we believe that it is more cost-effective and personal to bring our showroom to you. We do not spend a massive amount of money on marketing. We use a grassroots approach and employ local students and people to canvass for us. We work by referral because a happy customer is a customer for life. Working off of referrals ensures that we will work hard on every job as our success depends on you giving us a good reference. 
 
Our second major goal is to give back to the local community and to specific charities that have an impact on people's lives. We strive to be a different kind of company. Not one that is just worried about the bottom line but one that is rooted in the community and places an emphasis on customer service and satisfaction. 

Karma Construction Group provides turn-key construction services from start to finish. We let you be as involved as you want and/or will do everything you need! We do anything and can customize any need or project. 

· Whole Home Renovations 
· Additions 
· Kitchen Design & Remodeling 
· Bath Design & Remodeling 
· Roofing Repair and Restoration 
· Storm Damage and Insurance Work 
· Siding and Exterior Restorations 
· Custom Basements 
· Windows & Doors 
· New Decks and Deck Restoration 
· Handyman Services 

Whether your project is a small remodel or a custom home you will receive the same high level of service that we are known for.

recent_review.body: I had the pleasure of working with Cliff Massey in 2022 on my home renovations. I originally hired a different contractor for the job, but that contractor fell through. That same day I went onto houzz.com looking for a contractor that could do renovations on my kitchen and painting of my entire house. I received two recommendations and Massey’s Painting & Home Improvement was one. I reached out to the two recommendations and Cliff called me within 30 mins of me pressing the button for a consultation. He was at my home within 2 hours with his crew to asset the job. I was so impress with his professionalism and out right knowledge of the job I hired him on the spot. He walked me through budgeting as well as he referred me to a lot of vendors to get my materials which were all affordable. The next week Cliff had his crew at my home to begin the work. I can honestly say Cliff picks the best team to work with. Jose and his crew were fantastic at getting the job done. During my renovation process I had an issue with by basement flooding, Cliff instantly referred me to his business partner and within a couple of days I had no more flooding. I received so many complaints on my home as it looked like a whole different house.  I will definitely recommend Massey’s Painting & Home Improvement to anyone in need of painting or home improvement needs.

featured_review.text: Massey's Painting & Home Improvement has been our go to company for home improvements.

57997637.description:

66368136.description:
I am delighted to introduce Sonny’s Renovations LLC, a licensed general contracting firm dedicated to delivering unparalleled remodeling services for both commercial and residential properties. With a commitment to excellence and a wealth of expertise, we offer a comprehensive suite of services, ranging from tenant build-outs (commercial), to complete home renovations.

**Our Extensive Range of Services Includes:**

1. **Flooring:** Transform your space with our diverse flooring options, including Epoxy, Reflective, hermetic coating, LVT/VCT, decorative concrete overlay, hardwood, laminate, tile, luxury vinyl, and more.

2. **Carpentry:** Our skilled craftsmen specialize in steel and wood framing, millwork, and the installation of doors, windows, and acoustic tiles, ensuring precision and attention to detail.

3. **Painting and Drywall:** From conceptualization to execution, our team provides professional painting and drywall services that add the perfect finishing touch to your interiors.

4. **Kitchens and Baths:** Elevate your living spaces with our expertise in creating custom kitchens and luxurious bathrooms that blend functionality with style.

5. **Decking and Fencing:** Deck framing available in steel or wood options. Fencing can be composite, steel, iron, or wood. We design and build outdoor spaces that reflect your unique vision.

6. **Electrical, Plumbing, HVAC:** Our comprehensive services extend to electrical, plumbing, and HVAC work, ensuring the safety, comfort, and efficiency of your property.

7. **Demolition:** We provide professional and efficient demolition services, clearing the way for your remodeling project with precision and safety.

At Sonny’s Renovations, we take pride in our ability to turn your vision into reality. Our team of experienced professionals is dedicated to delivering projects on time, within budget, and with an unwavering commitment to quality.

recent_review.body: We loved working with Jim and his crew. We planned two phases, beginning first with the complete kitchen gut and remodel, leveling the floor to an enclosed addition which opened up to the kitchen, removing walls to and entry/ living/stairway to create more light and an open concept in our 1957 split level ranch.  Beautiful cabinets, room divider and bannister created by Jim's carpenter/artisan from gorgeous live-edge walnut. Jim also reconfigured 3 bedrooms to create a walk-in closets for the master and larger closets for the other bedrooms making the house more efficient and updated to twenty-first century use and function. In the second phase, he created a movie/exercise room and additional bedroom in our unfinished basement with tray ceiling, and sound insulation. Works great!  Jim was very easy to work and communicate with and the work was professional and of great quality!  We would highly recommend Jim for residential renovations!

recent_review.body:
In March of 2021, we purchased a Zelaya remodel in Alexandria and would absolutely do it again. We love our home and appreciate the experience of working with Rachel and Jay on what was an unconventional purchase and subsequent work on the home. We looked at many homes in Alexandria but knew we wanted to purchase our house from the moment we saw it.
 
Rachel showed us two houses that she and Jay were working on in our neighborhood, and both were distinctly unique from any other homes we had seen. The layouts emphasized open living, convenience, and bright spaces. The design themes and choices were thoughtful and artfully realized, and it was clear that Jay emphasizes high-quality, solid construction.
 
The house we chose was unfinished, and Jay went out of his way to work with us to get it to the move-in stage as fast as possible and on our schedule. Likewise, he worked with us to address the inevitable growing pain issues with new construction several months after purchasing the home. We’ve worked with several contractors on other projects, and Jay is the rare professional who will stand by his work and stick with you until any and all issues get resolved.

3797787.description:
With more than 25 years of experience serving our clients throughout Virginia, Maryland and D.C. , Zelaya Properties has developed a reputation for intelligent design, creative problem solving and an uncompromising commitment to professionalism and integrity that has made us one of the area's most respected and in-demand general contractors.

We provide a proactive and confident approach in working with our clients. We tell it like it is and our clients respect our no nonsense approach. This mutual respect is the foundation we build lifelong relationships on.

Why do we do it? We are in the business of building more than just physical spaces. We build Dreams, Futures, Comfort, Happiness, Security and Peace of Mind for our clients.

recent_review.body: I just finished my 6th project with WISA, a basement remodel. The fact that this was my 6th project with them should tell you all you need to know. This company treats you like a friend, not a customer. From the initial consultation, back and forth discussions on the design, material selection, and demo/construction, every person I worked with was a true professional. WISA uses no sub-contractors, so every employee is directed by the same management team. And every day during the work, someone from that management team, many times the owner himself, visits the worksite to make sure everything is going according to plan and that I am satisfied with the progress. Make sure you talk to this company for your next home improvement project. You will not be disappointed.

9631749.description: WISA is Northern Virginia's value leader for home remodeling services. We are a Virginia licensed and fully insured design build company located in Lorton, VA with a design center. We specialize in hassle free residential remodeling, kitchen remodeling, bathroom remodeling, flooring contractor and much more.

Maryland Contracting & Design is part of a long-standing tradition of building and remodeling in Maryland. For over 35 years the Tice family has been building and remodeling in Maryland and providing our customers with the finest craftsmanship and service for all their home improvement needs. Quality is the cornerstone of our business but it means much more to us then just the finished project. Its how we walk through the entire process with our clients to ensure we have fulfilled their dreams, as they have trusted us with their homes. 
Our family of designers and builders will treat your home like its our own and never settle for anything less than perfection.
Our process starts with our first conversation were we focus the design process on our customer's needs and desires. We make sure we take the time in the beginning of the process to capture all of our clients wishes in their new home improvement. From the initial layout to product selection we walk hand in hand with our clients to include all of their wishes while working within their budget. Our time tested method of design integrates our clients into the building process with their own project manager to oversee every aspect of the remodeling process. Our team of experts take care of all the behind the scenes steps from building permits to final inspections to ensure the building process runs seamlessly for you and your family.

26878907.description:
The North Star Companies LLC (NSC) is a well- established Maryland building company with a solid reputation for delivering customer satisfaction throughout every phase of a client's new home build, home renovation, addition or commercial build-out. Located in Harwood Maryland, North Star Companies LLC has earned its solid reputation building fine residential standard, semi-custom and custom homes; renovations and additions.

For new homes, we work closely with each client starting with a site analysis to assist with determining the best possible location to site the home, taking into consideration topography, location of utilities, well and septic systems, length of driveway, storm-water management requirements and overall orientation.

Our partner engineers and surveyors are integral to this process and provide a preliminary site plan to depict the proposed improvements. Next we review the building plans to advise on equipment location, especially within a basement with the goal of consolidating equipment to accommodate existing or future plans for finished spaces, locate basement windows and doors to maximize sunlight and to match the topography of the property, suggest architectural changes and refinements and finally review all site improvements (decks, patios, outdoor fireplaces and pits, walkways, driveways, et cetera) considered and incorporate them into the site plan and permit process.

Finally we conclude with a detailed interview to capture all features, options and changes so each client will have a complete package of all requirements and desires contemplated. This information is incorporated into a detailed standard feature and specifications description and is used as the guiding document from which to construct. The result is a well-built, energy-efficient home that is personal to each client we serve.

recent_review.body:
When my husband and I decided to build our dream house on the Severn River in Annapolis, we were absolute novices. Our only prior experience with renovations had been several kitchen remodels. We had no real understanding of what a major, whole-house renovation would entail. We knew we would need knowledgeable, experienced, proven professionals to guide us, and we were so fortunate to have found exactly the right team: Purple Cherry Architects and Bayview Builders.

It was Cathy Purple Cherry who introduced us to Bayview, and after meeting with Dave Carlisle and his team and seeing their work, we were sold. We liked the fact that they specialized in waterfront properties, came highly recommended by our architect, had good relationships with high-quality subcontractors, and offered an online “dashboard” to provide full transparency on every aspect of the job.

We had regular meetings with the Bayview team, both onsite and in their office, to review progress and discuss any concerns. The entire team was extremely professional and clearly dedicated to ensuring our complete satisfaction with our new home. Whenever we had a question, we got a prompt, complete and easy-to-understand answer either from Chad Dowling, our construction manager, or from Dave Carlisle directly. 

Similarly, when their team had questions about our preferences or other matters, they were quick to get our thoughts and keep construction moving forward.

Any project the size and scope of ours inevitably requires change orders as it moves from drawings to reality, and Bayview’s tracking system was extremely helpful when we made these changes. We were able to review it online, see the impact on the budget and schedule, and sign off electronically. This type of efficiency really helped to keep the project moving. In addition, it provided a record of every single transaction that went into the creation of our house, including the cost of all subcontractor services and all materials.

Throughout the process, Bayview continually stood behind the quality of its work and the work of its subcontractors and made sure we were completely satisfied with every aspect of the house – even going so far as re-working several items at their own expense.

As a result, we are thrilled with our new home. It is everything we imagined and more. Dave, Chad and the entire Bayview team became more than our builders, they were our partners in turning a dream into reality. We couldn’t be happier with the home or our experience building it.
We were so happy, in fact, we are continuing our relationship with Bayview, using their services to maintain our home. 

In short, Bayview Builders is a talented, professional team led by an honest, knowledgeable, experienced and fair-minded leader – it doesn’t get much better!

2954570.description: I have built the business with four principles in mind: honesty, integrity, loyalty and craftsmanship. Honesty to me is the transparency of everything we do from billing to how your project is executed. I want you to know everything I know. Integrity is our ability to hold ourselves to the highest standard no matter who is watching or who we are working for. Loyalty is the relationship between me, my employees and my subcontractors. I want to create a team atmosphere. This is one reason our employees retention is one of the highest in the area. Craftmanship is quality work at every stage, from the fit of the first rafter down to the fit of the last piece of crown molding in the kitchen.

recent_review.body: I highly recommend Jesse Davis/River View Contracting to everyone. Jesse completed a 24’ x 32’ workshop for me on a challenging, slopped site, near the water. Jesse was easy to work with and share my ideas. He listened to my needs and made recommendations that were spot-on. He worked with my budget and has an excellent standard of quality. He did it all, from permit to certificate of occupancy. He is very nice to work with and followed through on everything. He went the extra mile, when he installed the LED lighting and all of the electrical beyond my expectations. He finished on Budget and schedule despite weather hold-ups.  He matched the house and shed beautifully, as well. Thanks Jesse. (We are already discussing a possible new project.) Another note: Jesse gave me 4 references that I talked with and they were all happy with him, too!

Working with Darren and everyone at Think Make Build was a pleasure.  Ours was a big project with a number of surprises along the way because it is an old house.  Darren and our project manager were to top of everything, kept us up to date at all times, addressed concerns that we had, and really listened to us, which I appreciated very much.  They were also great about communicating with our architect and working through details of each part of the project before jumping in.  Everyone worked very hard to stick to the schedule and to get our family of five back into our house as soon as possible.  And Darren was really great about actually finishing up every detail of the project--no items left dangling on the punchlist for months.  He also followed up to make sure everything was working as it should and that we were happy with the project.  For the couple of things that didn't turn out as promised, Darren quickly made it right and made sure we were happy with the product and the price.  I highly recommend Think Make Build!

3504830.description: We are a custom builder, working in the worlds of both residential and commercial construction, and we are passionate about our craft. Our job is not simply to build, but it is to listen, provide guidance, and find solutions. Builder is a title we don with pride. It captures our passion for distinctive architectural space and our expertise in solving an intricate puzzle. Our experience has equipped us well to handle projects of varying magnitude and complexity, from the renaissance of a distinctive century-old residence to the materialization of an innovative ground-up structure. Our objective is to understand the inspiration behind each decision and respond by crafting a space that reflects the vision flawlessly.

recent_review.body:
Kathy Tufts is a talented designer. I hired her several years ago and she was wonderful. Because of her talent she was my choice for remodeling a bathroom. This is a list of went wrong during the construction:

A.Toilet and tub are wrong color and the bathtub is the shorter than the previous bathtub.  I requested a bright white toilet and tub multiple times. Also, the bathtub it is not level after installation. 

B.A mosaic made of ¼ inch glass tiles was not competently installed and the mosaic and the side walls’ ¼ inch glass tiles do not reach the ceiling as planned. The bathtub before the remodel was higher and the measurements for the mosaic and side walls tile were taken from it. The tile goes to varying heights on the walls. Where the side wall tiles and the mosaic meet at the corners of the walls there is more space than there should be. The workers tried to fill in the spaces where the mosaic was too short or not wide enough but the pattern/colors of the tile do not match the pattern of the mosaic. The white thin set shows significantly between some of the seams where the six pieces of the mosaic were joined. The thin set will need to be picked out before being grouted because grout will not cover the thin set since the tiles are so small and there is not enough space between the face and the back of the 1/4 inch tiles.

C.The bathroom vanity came with the drawers on the right side and the door of the cabinet on the left side instead of the other way around. The plumbing had to be moved to fit the configuration of the new cabinet as the previous cabinet was the opposite configuration.

D.The marble top of the vanity has one hole for the faucet instead of the Moen Banbury three holed faucet that was purchased.

E.The Moen Banbury bathtub hardware set came with plumbing valve. The valve is in the box while the wallboard and glass tiles have already been installed. The fixtures were available at the start of the remodel.

Since I know next to nothing about construction I hired a remodeling company to evaluate the work and write a report. Also, a neighbor who is a carpenter and former home inspector looked at the project along with a handyman I use. I contacted the mosaic company and I found a mosaic expert through a tile shop who came to look at the mosaic. They each contributed to the list. The mosaic company, the remodeling company and the mosaic installer agreed the mosaic needs to be demolished and redone by an experienced installer because it is very difficult to repair the mosaic.

The project is not complete.

DiMarco and Associates did a total remodel of my kitchen, from the floor up. Matthew is so knowledgeable about all aspects of design and construction. Thank you for considering our company to assist you with repairing, expanding or adding functionality and beauty to your home. Ravensworth Custom Home Improvements LLC believes two things about what we do and how we do it. First, it is our God-given responsibility to treat you, your family and your home just as we would want someone to treat us and ours. We get it, this is not just a house, it's YOUR home; the place where love and laughter happen, comfort and healing are

recent_review.body:

I even bought them italian ices one day when it was hot. Lol

We had a misunderstanding one day and they were wonderful... The deck is still wonderful, no sign of wear.

18484114.description:
People Want Value, Honesty and Respect - These are the pillars on which our company is built.

My wife and I started this business with one goal in mind – to provide the absolute best customer service and best dollar value to our customers that we possibly can…and it’s why we are adamant about treating each and every one of our customers like they are family.

My wife and I both started out our careers in customer service and over the years we started to realize that customer service in this country was only getting worse and that companies were willing to do almost anything to pad their profits. From importing cheaper materials from China to short changing vendors and contractors. We quit our very lucrative jobs, disgusted with the industry.

Shortly thereafter we decided to start our own company – vowing to be different.

As we said before:

How could my wife or I, who live, work, and play in the same community as are clients, look at each other in the eyes, or look at you, our friends, or our neighbors in the eye if we did not take that trust seriously, or if we were perfectly content to do shoddy work, or if we were a take the money and run company? The bottom line is that we couldn’t.

Look, at the end of the day a home improvement / remodel is about more than just money, or roofs, or windows, or anything else…it really is about one thing and one thing only… Your Family. You see, we know that your friends, family, children or even grand-children eat, live, and sleep under “your roof;” when you ask for a remodel what you are really doing is trusting us with their safety, security and well-being. This is a sacred trust and one that we take very, very seriously…it’s why our clients are not clients…THEY ARE FAMILY and that is the reason why we will never let a customer down – regardless of the cost - PERIOD.

recent_review.body: I am an architect in Washington DC and after drawing the plans for a full remodel and renovation of the kitchen in my 1906 rowhouse, I contracted Barratt Construction to do the work.  Peter and David were extremely professional and easy to work with, and were able to complete the project for us in a very timely manner (which was very important to us).  Not to mention they executed the work beautifully.  They were easy to communicate with throughout the project and were helpful in offering suggestions to us on where we could improve the project as we uncovered a couple unanticipated existing conditions.  Overall I had a great experience working with Peter and David and I would highly recommend Barratt Construction Services for home renovations and builds.  I will use them again for future projects.

23200931.description:
Barratt Construction provides quality remodeling for home and business owners in Washington DC, Maryland and Virginia. We work with respected designers, architects, and engineers to deliver timely, cost effective solutions for our clients. 

All services offered are completed in-house by our full-time teams; because we don’t use sub-contractors, we control the process from start to finish. This gives our clients a more efficient, higher quality remodeling experience.

As a full-service contractor specializing in custom solutions, our projects often involve expanding the square footage of an existing property; with additions, basement remodels, and adding floors to the footprint of the home. Whole house remodels, and stunning kitchen and bathrooms are our trademark.

recent_review.body: My husband and I moved into our forever home, but we knew it needed some work. One of the first things we tackled was the flooring throughout the main level and basement. The previous owners had hardwood flooring and ceramic tile. Unfortunately, the ceramic tile was damaged, and given the age of the home, we couldn't find wood flooring that would match the existing floors after removing the tile. We needed some professional advice and decided to reach out to Unique Property Investment Group. BEST DECISION EVER!!! recent_review.body: The Contigo Group met our highest expectations. In a few words, the team was courteous, friendly, professional, skilled, resourceful, and efficient. But isn't that what you would expect from your contractor? What else would cause one to select The Contigo Group? Our principal criterion for selection of a contractor to do the minor construction, significant repair, and major painting was "quality." The old 19th Century house was completely gutted, rebuilt inside and out, and painted two years before we purchased the house. But, the original work by another contractor was not completely up to our satisfaction. We selected The Contigo Group because we had seen their beautiful work on a nearby residence and had confidence that they could meet our expectations. There are a few particular characteristics of their work that deserve special note. The lead contractor, Mauricio, has a quick and discerning perspective. He can spot a flaw in the design, construction, installation, or interior decoration in an instant. He showed us that he is an expert in painting, but he also evinced that his expertise covers most everything in a home. That means that he can see what needs to be done, in many cases, even before we identified the work. That was very helpful, because he knew exactly how to fix the issues he or we identified. Thus, he has a particularly keen eye for paint/interior attributes, including colors, texture, surface hardness, clean lines, and overall quality of appearance. Furthermore, The Contigo Group had sufficient resources available to do the work promptly. We had other contractors whom we trusted to do the work, but it was a big job and we were not prepared to have the work extend over many, many weeks. Mauricio delivered sufficient resources to make significant daily progress, but not so many that overwhelmed us as we continued to live in the house during the work period. Another thing about Mauricio's workforce: some of his crew were so highly skilled, that he could trust them with nearly any part of the job. That meant that continual progress wasn't dependent upon his constant presence, supervision, and direction. Work was accomplished quickly. Perhaps most important, Mauricio listens to his customers; he is creative in his solutions; and he is willing to experiment with alternatives to satisfy even the most demanding home owner. We are very satisfied. You will be too.

recent_review.body: Jenny and Gary are very nice. Unfortunately, they had many problems communicating with me on getting my bathrooms remodeled. I was told I would get a blue vanity and white sink with a faucet I picked, but a gray/black vanity was installed with a speckled sink and countertop. Eventually the sink was replaced with a white one but they would not replace the vanity or paint it. A completely different faucet was also put in. My hall bathroom was to take 8-10 days and it took about a month and had a leak in the sink. My family did not like hearing them yell at their workers in front of them and when there were problems, Gary would only say- call my wife. They were to begin my powder room but seemed to have little interest in doing so because after I called and agreed to proceed even though I was unhappy with the hall bathroom, after 2 weeks I never heard from them. Finally, I asked for my money back. They refunded it without a problem and told me they had a death in their family. They could have texted or emailed me if that were true, like responsible business owners. I was very disappointed, especially after addressing communication concerns I had read about prior to signing my contract. Highly unsatisfied!!!

3150071.description:

In-house plumber and electrician. Call and schedule your Free In Home Estimate.

recent_review.body: I am a first time home buyer and my new home needed several repairs. I happened to visit a friend in the plush new apartment complex at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue Southeast above the Harris Teeter and loved some of the work that was done. I researched and called Traditions General Contracting who were kind enough to listen and answer all of my silly or minute questions. The work the did in basement and bathroom was truly Immaculate. I'm happy every time I shower. Professionalism, expertise and cost effectiveness are understatements for these guys.

Ryan Keith did an amazing job on our outdoor project, turning a neglected small yard into a beautiful living space. He did all the hardscaping and landscaping for the project. He was easy to work with, got the project done on time, was flexible with changes, and available to answer all our questions.

7951382.description: Client focused and environmentally aware, redux is a comprehensive project management team for your GARDEN + HOME.

recent_review.body:
From beginning to end, our experience with Zion Home Remodeling was excellent.  After my wife and I purchased a house, we knew there was a lot of remodeling we wanted to complete before moving in. 
 Shortly after we found Zion Home Remodeling's website and reached out to Antulio, the General Manager, he contacted us to set up a time to visit our home and go over our plans for remodeling.  He provided an extremely detailed quote.  We knew exactly what would be done and at what price.  Antulio's promptness and professionalism, and his clear knowledge of his field, impressed us.

The project itself, which involved repainting the entire interior of the house, refinishing the floors, and doing other smaller fixes, couldn't have gone better.  The team was timely, friendly, and extremely hard-working.  It was also the same men every day, which made us feel more comfortable about having contractors accessing the property on a daily basis.  

Antulio promptly answered all our questions and was very flexible with adding smaller projects in the middle of the remodeling, such as cabinet lighting and some exterior painting.  He also made recommendations about improvements we hadn't considered, such as replacing the antique attic access with a modern folding ladder.  Most importantly, Antulio and his team were understanding when we found little things that needed to be adjusted.  And, best of all, they made themselves available to touchup aspects of the job after we moved in, such as fixing a little paint chipping from the moving company, and so forth.

My wife and I highly recommend Zion Home Remodeling.  They do great work at an extremely reasonable rate.  They didn't go over budget and they stayed on schedule completing the project.  Finally, they were responsive and prompt, and trustworthy and friendly.  All highly desired qualities when looking for a contractor!

9032582.description:
Zion Home Remodeling® is proud to offer expert interior remodeling services to homeowners in Prince George's and Montgomery Counties, Maryland. With years of experience, we specialize in providing high-quality home renovation services, including kitchen and bathroom remodeling, basement renovation, and water damage restoration. 
Kitchen remodeling is the most popular home improvement project that can significantly enhance your home's functionality, appearance, and value. A well-designed kitchen remodeling can improve the space's functionality and create a more inviting and aesthetically pleasing environment for cooking and entertaining. Kitchen remodeling can include various updates such as replacing old appliances with new energy-efficient models, installing new cabinets, upgrading countertops, changing the layout to improve workflow, and adding new lighting or fixtures. Zion Home Remodeling® is here to help you get the job done right; whether you want to modernize an outdated kitchen or create a stylish space, kitchen remodeling can be a worthwhile investment, providing long-term benefits for you and your family.
Bathroom remodeling is another popular home improvement project that can help enhance your home's appearance, functionality, and value. It involves upgrading various aspects of your bathroom, such as fixtures, lighting, flooring, and cabinetry, to create a more modern and comfortable space. Whether you want to create a luxurious spa-like bathroom, add more storage space, or improve accessibility for seniors or those with mobility issues, bathroom remodeling can help you achieve your goals. With the help of professional contractors like Zion Home Remodeling®, homeowners in Prince George's County and Montgomery County, MD, can get the bathroom of their dreams.
Basement remodeling can be a great way to increase the usable space in your home while also adding value to your property. A finished basement can be versatile for various purposes, such as a home theater, game room, or even an additional bedroom or living area. We offer comprehensive basement remodeling services to transform your underutilized space into a functional, attractive living area. 
Contact Zion Home Remodeling® today to learn how we can transform your home into the space you've always dreamed of.

recent_review.body: Empire builders has done alot of work for me over the past 20 years, including redoing my kitchen and adding on a Mahogany screened in porch. recent_review.body: We hired Jabs to finish our basement.  From start to finish this family run business made the process as stress free as possible.  Every person involved was polite and professional.  Jabs went above and beyond our expectations.  We are very happy with the end results and would definitely use them again.  Thank you to all involved with the renovation.  Special thanks to Tim, Chris, and Colleen for being there to answer any question I might have.

Jabs Construction Inc. is a full-service design/build residential remodeling company. We are a Virginia Class “A” licensed contractor. We serve the following areas: Prince William County; to include Lake Ridge, Montclair, Ashland, Woodbridge; Stafford County and Fairfax County; to include Mt. Vernon, Gunstan Hall, Springfield.

Jabs Construction provides complete contracting services for projects ranging from small trim repairs to whole-house remodeling with an emphasis on house additions, kitchen remodels and bathroom remodels. Many of our projects have been recognized with various design awards.

Our office staff, master carpenters and experienced crew follow through on all aspects of the project to provide our clients with the attention they deserve by delivering them a timely, quality constructed finished product.

In addition to our complete remodeling services, Jabs Construction maintains an Architectural Department and an Electrical Division. Our Architectural Department enables us to provide a seamless transition from initial design concept… through final design… to constructed project. The in-house design/build team provides clients with the full-service remodeling experience to include 3D modeling and virtual design. Our Electrical Division, lead by our licensed master electrician, completes all the electrical work necessary for the remodeling projects Jabs Construction completes. Our Electrical Division is also available to complete any and all electrical service calls our clients may need.

recent_review.body: We had a small repair job on the soffit on the second floor.  About 10 feet was damaged in a wind storm. The work was well done and the team at Olde Port was very professional.  I would gladly call them first for future work.

recent_review.body: Unprofessional, repeated no-shows and late, lack of supervision, poor communication, constant cutting corners, and poor workmanship. 3 week job ended up taking over 3 months 2018. They failed to obtain required permits and used unlicensed workers to conduct plumbing and electrical work. They even cut a truss in my roof and tried to cover it up, among other shoddy work. No exaggeration -- every single thing they did needed to be redone, some up to 4-5 times. I give them some credit for offering design suggestions, eventually acting like they cared, and warranty fixes, but it was simply too little, too late. I deeply regret choosing this company.

recent_review.body: I have been waiting since 5-6-23  for repair work to be completed on the door installed in my sunroom, to no avail.  After multiple calls a repairman from Medallion came on 6-13-23 , the second repairman came on 9-13-23 and the third repairman came on 9-15-23 to each  access the problem.  At that time I showed the last repairman that as a result of the problem with the door the wood flooring near the door had warped due to water damage.  He informed me that it would take 5 days to get the replacement wood. I called Medallion to get an update on the wood replacement on 10-2-23 and the office had no idea that I was still waiting for the repair work to be done and said they would get back to me.  During this whole process I have been the one contacting Medallion.  To date I have not heard from them.

recent_review.body: Tyler Construction Company transformed a tiny and tired master bath into a more useful, pleasant space. We couldn't be happier with the work they performed, would highly recommend this family-owned business, and will definitely use Tyler Construction Company again!  *The photos below don't do justice to their labor!

Lauer Construction, Inc. is a custom home builder serving the Anne Arundel County and Eastern Shore regions of Maryland. Located in Annapolis, we specialize in custom homes, additions and remodel projects. We're celebrating over 45 years of building the dreams of our family of clients.  
Lauer Construction understands the requirements for waterfront, steep land property, and accessible design as well as the requirements for remodel and new home build in historic locations.
 Lauer Construction, with over 45 years of award winning building experience, stands out from the competitors thanks to outstanding customer service, a team of highly trained superior craftsmen and years of professional, dedicated experience.
Are you ready to build your dream home or remodel your existing home?
  Lauer Construction will work with you to build your dreams and we invite you to browse through our building project portfolio, review our approach, and then contact us. We look forward to discussing your dream project and including you in our family of satisfied clients.

recent_review.body:
None better!!!  We are ecstatic we went with Aspect for our major remodel!  The project was huge.  A complete remodel of kitchen & family room, addition of large pantry and 18 x 21 ft room over the kitchen (ROK) with full bath.  This was a major makeover and Aspect nailed every “aspect” of it!
 
Their expert carpenters & installers handled everything in the kitchen, fam rm, pantry & ROK (cabinets, appliances, paint, stain, finish work, etc.) as well as install of 3 windows, 4 ext doors, 2 tons of HVAC, flight of stairs, full bath, and 12 ft combination mantle-countertop made from exotic wood.  Top quality workmanship and absolute accountability are the hallmarks of the Aspect team starting with their contract project manager/owner Ryan Long & Kevin Grimes.
 
Aspect’s ability to succeed goes far beyond their organic expertise.  Their performance as general contractor (GC) was exceptional.  Communications, coordination, sequencing, flexibility, care, expert design advice, trust and efficiency are words that describe Aspect as GC.  This was the most important reason the project was completed on time, on budget, at high quality with almost no rework.
 
For any large remodel, we absolutely recommend having a GC and unequivocally recommend Aspect to fill the role.  They ran it all: plumbing, electrical, HVAC, flooring, insulation, sheet rock, paint, supply chain, etc.  You cannot get a better GC than Aspect and you don’t want to do it yourself!
 
Aspect took the beautiful design done by Joni Zimmerman at DSI Solutions and made it happen.  They brought each of these rooms down to the 2x4s and expertly and beautifully put them back together at a very reasonable price!  Aspect is a great team and we could not be happier!!!

What started out as a bathroom remodel turned into a major renovation once we saw the dedication, hard work, and craftsmanship of EZ Contracting.  On the first day they showed up when expected and treated our home like their own.  They protected the floors with tarps, set up electric tools outside, and even put up with our bossy little dog who was 'supervising' the whole time. Each day they left the project as tidy as possible so we weren't left with exposed electrical wires or other hazards. The expert tile work is truly amazing and is the centerpiece of the new bathroom! We also had them tear out some old tile in the entry way and they perfectly matched hardwood to the existing floor, which was then sanded and refinished with an updated stain, showing no signs of the old tile. Two new exterior doors were replaced, all upstairs walls were expertly repainted, and 10 recessed lights were installed in the living room and dining room to make it look like a new, beautiful home! Every detail was covered, every inch and corner was perfect, the work truly exceeded our expectations! Mr. Ho was a pleasure to work with, having years of experience in this area he was able to offer helpful suggestions and provided us with ideas throughout the process. We would highly recommend EZ Contracting for all your remodeling needs and would happily hire them again for future projects!

recent_review.body:
In November of 2012 we moved into our now home in Bethesda MD. The process was challenging at times however we worked through many of issues with NDI Homes of MD. In early October of 2013 we had a site visit by NDI owner Tom Lizzo along with a new site manager to address some issues to make sure we could move in by November. One of those issues was the presence of Mold in the garage and a mold/musty smell in the basement. NDI hired a professional to remediate and remove the mold and told us the smell in the basement would eventually go away. In March of 2013 we had our 90 day walk through some general issues along with some open issues from a Site Visit dated 10-23-12. The general issues included some minor repairs, several items that were to be addressed by the subs, and several areas of drywall cracking near the trim and some on a few walls. The drywall items seemed normal considering the settling of the house. The drywall issue was repaired however over the course of the next few months some of the areas of cracking came back along with entire seems of drywall starting to appear in the Master Bathroom and Bedroom. Eight foot sections of the seems of the drywall are visible. We bought this up (in addition to the smell in the basement) in our 11 month walk through and some of the drywall repair was done however the contractor for NDI, Jeff Rock, said he would have to get approval to do the drywall seam repairs. This was in January of 2014. I had never heard back so I contacted Heidi Thomas on May 7, 2014 to which she told me she would have it taken care of and that Jeff Rock would schedule an appointment. I then followed up via email 5 times before I received an answer on June 5, 2014. Heidi said Jeff Rock had been contacted and would reach out to me shortly. On June 20, 2014 I reached out to Jeff Rock myself only to find out he was never told to preform he repairs. I contacted Heidi immediately only to get an answer on June 24, 2014 that Tom Lizzo would not approve the work order until a permit issue was resolved with Montgomery County. During the construction of my home the site conditions called for a large retaining wall that was outsourced to a Great Scapes. NDI site-super Steve Point (who was fired at the completion of my home)told Great Scapes that the wall was permitted and to start construction. On May 11, 2014 I was notified by Montgomery County Department Of Permitting Services that the retaining wall was never permitted. They conducted an investigation and issued NDI Homes a Notice of Violation along with Great Scapes for doing the work. Great Scapes acted on the information from the NDI Site-Super. Montgomery County is requiring either NDI Homes or Great Scapes to go through the permitting process to resolve the case. Of course this has nothing to do with the drywall issues in our home however NDI has refused to honor their commitment and stand by their product not to mention it took 12 emails and 18 voice mails to find this out. Unfortunately the above issue is a minor issue compared to the other outstanding issues we need addressed. I mentioned to NDI that the Hardy Plank on the exterior of the home is at grade level and I learned that there should be a minimum of 6 inches between the grade and the Hardy material. NDI Homes performed the final grade of the house and is refusing to even acknowledge the problem. In addition as mentioned above our basement continues to have a mold/musty smell. We have had several folks look at it including the HVAC company and they find it unusual that it still smells this long after construction. And finally today we found mold in our garage, something that was supposed to be taken care of back in October of 2013. This was the final straw and I have no confidence that NDI will resolve the situation.  I am happy to share my experience in detail to anyone that is considering them - email me at vtohan@gmail.com


We are looking to resolve these issues starting with the most basic and urgent first: 1. Mold in Garage - mold on the wall separating the two garage doors needs to be remediated and repaired along with finding the root cause of its presence. Keep in mind this was an issue NDI acknowledged on the 10-23-12 site visit 2. Mold/musty smell in basement - odor in basement needs to be resolved and root cause needs to be determined. Also an issue from 10-23-12 site visit 3. Drywall Issues - the evidence of seams coming apart in the Master Bedroom and Bathroom is clearly an issue of sub-standard workmenship and was identified to NDI within the 12 month home warranty. In addition I have email correspondence confirming that contractor was scheduled however NDI had no intention of fixing. 4. Final Grade - grade level is touching the Hardy Plank material. I confirmed with manufacture and Montgomery County that there should be 6 inches between grade and material. This needs to be addressed. 5. Permit for Retaining wall - Site-super coordinated the entire construction of the wall (I have several emails that I sent to the county) and claimed that it was permitted. Based on that Great Scapes preformed the work. Site-Super fired after the completion of the house for many situations just like this one. NDI needs to obtain permit and have Montgomery County close the case.
